markets.location: Old Delhi, adjacent to Red Fort
markets.name: Chandni Chowk
markets.speciality: Historic 17th‑century bazaar famous for street food, textiles, jewelry, and spices

markets.name: Dilli Haat
markets.speciality: Open‑air craft bazaar offering regional handicrafts, traditional food stalls, and cultural performances

markets.name: Khan Market
markets.speciality: Upscale market known for imported snacks, cafés, and boutique shopping

markets.name: Sarojini Nagar
markets.speciality: Cheap designer clothing and surplus export‑quality brands

markets.name: Connaught Place
markets.speciality: Colonial‑style circular market with shops, restaurants, and easy metro access

markets.name: Janpath
markets.speciality: Bargain shopping for handicrafts, accessories, and souvenirs

markets.name: Khari Baoli
markets.speciality: Asia's largest spice market, famed for aromatic spices and ingredients

monuments.name: Red Fort
monuments.speciality: 17th‑century Mughal fortress, UNESCO World Heritage Site

monuments.name: Jama Masjid
monuments.speciality: Grand mosque that can accommodate up to 25,000 worshippers

monuments.name: Qutub Minar
monuments.speciality: 73 m brick minaret, UNESCO World Heritage Site, blend of Indian and Islamic architecture

monuments.name: India Gate
monuments.speciality: 42 m war memorial and popular public gathering space

monuments.name: Humayun's Tomb
monuments.speciality: Persian‑style mausoleum with gardens, UNESCO World Heritage Site

monuments.name: Lotus Temple
monuments.speciality: Contemporary Baháʼí House of Worship with distinctive flower‑like architecture

activities.description: Experience pottery making and ceramics trails in Delhi and nearby areas like Khurja and Assam. Includes hands‑on workshops, museum demonstrations, and dedicated pottery retreats.
activities.name: Pottery Making

activities.description: Visit iconic Delhi landmarks such as the Red Fort, Humayun’s Tomb, Qutab Minar, Jama Masjid, and other UNESCO World Heritage sites.
activities.name: Historical Tours

activities.description: Participate in block printing, weaving, and other handicraft workshops that showcase India’s artistic heritage.
activities.name: Cultural Workshops

activities.description: Explore the Crafts Museum in Pragati Maidan where artisans demonstrate pottery, embroidery, weaving, carving, and more.
activities.name: Crafts Museum Visit

activities.description: Join multi‑day pottery retreats (e.g., Aura Pottery) offering both hand‑building and wheel‑throwing sessions for beginners and enthusiasts.
activities.name: Pottery Retreats

activities.description: While not in Delhi, India offers trekking in Ladakh, paragliding in Himachal, river rafting in Rishikesh, and scuba diving in the Andaman Islands.
activities.name: Adventure Sports (outside Delhi)

famous_activities.availability: Available in Delhi and nearby regions
famous_activities.name: Pottery

# Temperature Data of Delhi

The average Temperature of Delhi is around 25°C although it vary from around 13°C during Winter (January) to 33°C during the Monsoon (June). The hottest month of the year is June with temperature varies from 26.5°C to 41.2°C. The coolest month is of the year is January, with temperature varies from 6.0°C to 22.8°C.

candidateLinks.content:
January, with an average low of 6.9 °C (44.4 °F) and a high of 19.3 °C (66.7 °F). In early March, the wind direction changes from north-westerly to south-westerly. From April to October, the weather is hot. The monsoon arrives at the end of June, along with an increase in humidity.[citation needed] The brief, mild winter starts in late November, peaks in January, and heavy fog often occurs. Delhi receives an average annual precipitation of 774.4 mm (30.49 in). [...] Delhi features a dry winter humid subtropical climate (Köppen Cwa) bordering a hot semi-arid climate (Köppen BSh). The warm season lasts from 21 March to 15 June with an average daily high temperature above 39 °C (102 °F). The hottest day of the year is usually in late May, with an average high of 42 °C (108 °F) and a low of 27 °C (81 °F). The cold season lasts from 26 November to 9 February with an average daily high temperature below 20 °C (68 °F). The coldest day of the year is usually in [...] | Daily mean °C (°F) | 13.8 (56.8) | 17.4 (63.3) | 22.7 (72.9) | 28.9 (84.0) | 32.7 (90.9) | 33.3 (91.9) | 31.5 (88.7) | 30.4 (86.7) | 29.5 (85.1) | 26.2 (79.2) | 20.5 (68.9) | 15.6 (60.1) | 25.2 (77.4) |
| Mean daily minimum °C (°F) | 7.5 (45.5) | 10.6 (51.1) | 15.6 (60.1) | 21.3 (70.3) | 25.8 (78.4) | 27.7 (81.9) | 27.5 (81.5) | 26.7 (80.1) | 25.0 (77.0) | 19.5 (67.1) | 13.0 (55.4) | 8.4 (47.1) | 18.9 (66.0) |
candidateLinks.title: Delhi - Wikipedia

candidateLinks.content: The climate of Delhi is characterized by extreme dryness, with intensely hot summers that can reach temperatures of about 113 °F (45 °C). Loo, or hot and dry winds, blow across the northern plains in the summer. Dust storms, locally known as andhis, can bring temporary relief in the summer months by causing a drop in temperature. Delhi is associated with a general prevalence of continental air (dry air that originates over continents), which moves in from the west or northwest, except during [...] The monsoon season normally begins in July and continues until the end of September. It is during these months that Delhi receives the bulk of its rainfall—roughly 23 inches (600 mm), or nearly three-fourths of the annual average. October and November constitute a transition period from monsoon to winter conditions. The dry winter season extends from late November to mid-March. The coldest month is January, with high temperatures in the low 70s F (about 21 °C) and low temperatures in the [...] high-30s F (about 4 °C). Delhi experiences severe air pollution in the winter months, with smog and severe PM2.5 and PM10 levels raising serious health concerns. AQI levels frequently reach the “very poor” (301 to 400) and “severe” (401 to 500) categories in the months of November and December, and Delhi consistently features as the most polluted capital city in the world. In recent years, climate change has resulted in unpredictable weather patterns, severe winters, and higher than usual

Delhi’s average temperature ranges from 57°F in January to 93°F in June. Though the rainfall isn’t as intense here as in other regions, the wettest month is August with an average of 9.6 inches of rain. [...] Mumbai is hot all year, with the temperature hitting 86°F even in the middle of winter. The average temperature ranges from 63°F in January to 91°F in May, though it can get much hotter than this. The monsoonal rains are intense from June through until early October, and this period sees minimal sunshine too, though travelers can expect sunny skies from November until May. [...] Return to India FAQs

candidateLinks.title: Delhi - Incredible India

candidateLinks.content:
+ Summer (April to June): Hot and dry, temperatures can soar above 40°C.
  + Monsoon (July to September): Humid with moderate rainfall.
  + Winter (October to March): Cool and foggy, with temperatures ranging from 8°C to 20°C — ideal for tourists.

### Festivals and Events to Experience [...] The climate in Delhi ranges from chilly winters to scorching summers, with the best time to explore being between October and March. For those planning a trip, there are many Delhi travel tips to enhance your experience — from dressing modestly at religious sites to using the Metro for convenient transportation. [...] A top tourist attraction, India Gate is a grand monument honoring Indian soldiers. Surrounded by lush lawns, it’s perfect for evening strolls and photography.

### Red Fort

This UNESCO World Heritage Site is one of the best tourist places in Delhi, known for its majestic Mughal architecture and vibrant sound-and-light shows.

### Qutub Minar

Standing tall since the 12th century, Qutub Minar is a must-visit place with Indo-Islamic architecture, making it a highlight of Delhi tourism.
candidateLinks.title: Delhi Travel Guide: Historical Monuments, Markets & Attractions

candidateLinks.content:
# Temperature Data of Delhi

The average Temperature of Delhi is around 25°C although it vary from around 13°C during Winter (January) to 33°C during the Monsoon (June). The hottest month of the year is June with temperature varies from 26.5°C to 41.2°C. The coolest month is of the year is January, with temperature varies from 6.0°C to 22.8°C.

candidateLinks.content:
May is the hottest month in New Delhi with an average temperature of 33°C (91°F) and the coldest is January at 13°C (55°F) with the most daily sunshine hours at 13 in May. The wettest month is July with an average of 180mm of rain..

candidateLinks.content: | Full Year  ---   SpringSummerFallWinter   ---   JanFebMarAprMayJunJulAugSepOctNovDec Climate and Average Weather Year Round in New Delhi NCT, India In New Delhi, the wet season is hot, oppressive, and partly cloudy and the dry season is warm and mostly clear. Over the course of the year, the temperature typically varies from 46°F to 103°F and is rarely below 42°F or above 110°F.  Based on the beach/pool score, the best times of year to visit New Delhi for hot-weather activities are from late [...] |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  ---  ---  ---  ---  ---  ---  ---  ---  ---  ---  ---  ---  ---  ---  ---  ---  ---  ---  ---  ---  ---  ---  ---  ---  ---  ---  | | Average | Jan | Feb | Mar | Apr | May | Jun | Jul | Aug | Sep | Oct | Nov | Dec |  ---  ---  ---  ---  ---  ---  | High | 68°F | 74°F | 85°F | 96°F | 102°F | 101°F | 95°F | 92°F | 92°F | 89°F | 81°F | 71°F | | [...] December 8 to February 14, with an average daily high temperature below 74°F. The coldest month of the year in New Delhi is January, with an average low of 47°F and high of 68°F.
